publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

msIdentifier.repository: Bibliothèque nationale de France, fonds Pelliot Koutchéen (Paris)

seg.seg: Sanskrit. Stibnite, rice root, mixed with honey [is] to be drunk with rice water [if] a five-fold
Stibnite, rice root, mixed with honey [is] to be drunk with rice water if a five-fold female disease has emerged, and [in case of] (dyspnea) clerodendrum with ginger. (61 and passim)

female disease [= menorrhagia] has emerged, and also [in case of] (dyspnea) Clerodendrum together with ginger. These remedies have to be increased gradually [and] a powder has to be prepared. It has to be eaten
[and it is] good in case of skin diseases. 17. Sanskrit.
Sanskrit. A decoction consisting of ricinus, of the heart of the fruit of Aegle marmelos, of two Solanum
indicum, of citron, of (Coleus) aromaticus [and] roots of Tribulus terrestris, [with addition] of barley alcali, of Asa foetida, of salt, of ricinus oil.
It makes disappear the five-fold pain in the hip, (in the shoulder), in the underbelly organ [= penis], in the heart. This powder has to be drunk together with ginger water. In diseases
of wind [and] of phlegma [it is] good. [If] Rubia cordifolia is (mixed with it), (then) [it is] to be drunk with barley water. 18. Sanskrit
If Rubia cordifolia is (mixed with it), then [it is] to be drunk with millet water. (61 and passim)
Sanskrit Asa foetida, Acorus calamus, salt, ginger,

Terminalia chebula, cumin, [the root] of Saussurea lappa, [the plant] Saussurea lappa. This [once made turned into] powder has to be increased bit by bit for each part; [it is] recommended in the [following] cases: [in the case] of abdomen tumor, of bowel disease,
constipation, choleras. These remedies have to be made bitter; rock salt [and] salt have to be added over it. A fine powder
has to be kneaded (with water) of three milk products [and] a clyster has to be (made). [It is] good in case of diseases beginning with [abdomen] tumor in a critical state. 19. Sanskrit

p.note: The text has the late/colloquial forms piś-yikne for piś-yäkne (a1, a6) and araṃśne for arañcne (a6).
For a detailed commentary and discussion of Sanskrit parallels, see in general .

The leaf consists of two fragments that make no joint (contrary to the plates in ). The smaller left one has the measure 3,9 x 8,5, the larger one 24,1 x 8,8; the size of the whole manuscript is known by the following leaves and . The left margin is lost here.

The reading piśpikne by Filliozat is wrong, so there is no word piśpik, pace 416. Instead we have piś-yikne, a colloquial form of piś-yäkne 'of five sorts'. According to the Sanskrit text, the pain in question concerns five body parts, but the Tocharian translator forgot the last term Skt. stana- 'breast, nipple' or maybe he included it in the translation of Skt. hṛdaya- 'heart'.
In raṇḍabilvā the final long vowel ā has been added by another hand; the form pāṣāṇabhe has likewise been corrected to pāṣāṇabhi.
°gandhābhi has been corrected into °gandhā«ṣ»i by another hand.

list.item: Bibliothèque nationale de France, fonds Pelliot Koutchéen (Paris)

Edition and complete translation: [[Lévi 1911a]]: 134-135; [[Filliozat 1948]]: 34-35, 38-40, 46; [[Carling 2003a]].
Corrections of Filliozat's edition: [[Sieg 1955]]: 64-67.
Translation: a1-2 [[Peyrot, ToSu]]: 685; b1 [[Peyrot, ToSu]]: 685.
The text has the late/colloquial forms piś-yikne for piś-yäkne (a1, a6) and araṃśne for arañcne (a6).

For a detailed commentary and discussion of Sanskrit parallels, see in general [[Carling 2003a]].

a3. In raṇḍabilvā the final long vowel ā has been added by another hand; the form pāṣāṇabhe has likewise been corrected to pāṣāṇabhi.

a1f., a6. The reading piśpikne by Filliozat is wrong, so there is no word piśpik, pace [[Adams, 2DoT]]: 416. Instead we have piś-yikne, a colloquial form of piś-yäkne 'of five sorts'. According to the Sanskrit text, the pain in question concerns five body parts, but the Tocharian translator forgot the last term Skt. stana- 'breast, nipple' or maybe he included it in the translation of Skt. hṛdaya- 'heart'.

b1. °gandhābhi has been corrected into °gandhā«ṣ»i by another hand.

Tamai-C14–

Lines Translation Pages
a1-2 Stibnite, rice root, mixed with honey [is] to be drunk with rice water if a five-fold female disease has emerged, and [in case of] (dyspnea) clerodendrum with ginger. ([[Carling 2003a]]: 61 and passim) 685
b1 If Rubia cordifolia is (mixed with it), then [it is] to be drunk with millet water. ([[Carling 2003a]]: 61 and passim) 685

The leaf consists of two fragments that make no joint (contrary to the plates in [[Filliozat 1948]]). The smaller left one has the measure 3,9 x 8,5, the larger one 24,1 x 8,8; the size of the whole manuscript is known by the following leaves [[PK AS 2B]] and [[PK AS 2C]]. The left margin is lost here.

a1 |(ni)haṃti : |śv(āsaṃ |bhārgīsaha)nāgare(na) || peṣke cautāṃ • kluṣṣa witsako • mitämpa tetriwoṣ kluṣṣe warsa yokalle • klaiññe|klaiñe teki piś-yäknesa|piś-yi|(kne)sa a2 tsäṅkau tākaṃ_(Sg.)|tākaṃ (anāṣṣälñe ṣä)p • bhārk śle tvāṅkaro : toy saṃtkenta tanākkaisa tsämṣallona cūrṇ|cūrmä yamaṣṣälle|yamaṣle | śwālle kuṣṭhanmane|ku|(ṣṭha)nmane a3 kartse 10(-7 || |e)raṇḍabilvā |bṛhatidvayaṃñca |mātuluṅga : |pāṣāṇabhi |tṛkaṭu |mūlakṛtakaṣāya : |sakṣāra a4 |hiṅgulavaṇo(rubutai)lamiśra : |śroṇyaṃsameḍhrahṛdayastanarukṣu |peyaṃ || hirant • pilamātti|pilamāti • wi prahatinta|praha|(ti)nta a5 • mā(tu)l(uṅk pāṣā)ṇa(bhit) • klyotaiṣṣana witsaka«ṃ»ṣṣe kaṣāy | yawakṣār : aṅkwaṣṭ|aṃkwaṣ • wiralom • hiraṇḍaṣṣe ṣalype|ṣa|(lype) a6 oñine (āntsene) tsai : indrine • arañcne|araṃśne • piś-yäkne|piś-yikne lakle wikäṣṣäṃ_(Prs.)|wikäṣṣäṃ | se cūrṇ|curm tvāṅkaracce warsa yokalle yente leśpaṣṣana b1 (teka)nmane kar(ts)e (tumpa ritt)au bhant tākaṃ_(Sg.)|tākaṃ ot ypiye warsa yokalle 18 || |hiṅgugragandhāṣi |ḍaśuṇṭyajājīharītakīpuṣka- b2 |(ra)mūla(k)u(ṣ)ṭha(ṃ) |(bhāgottaraṃ |cu)rṇī(tam |eta)d |iṣṭam • |gulmodarājīrṇaviṣūcikāsu || aṅkwaṣṭ|aṅkwaṣ • okaro • wiralom • tvāṅkaro • arirāk|a|(ri)rāk b3 • ayā(j)ñ(i • pu)śśo • kaṣṣu • bhākottärsa : tanākkai • tanākkai tsämṣalle se cūrṇ|curm • tune papālau • kwarmne • udāvartne|u|(dā)vartne b4 • acirne (• vi)ṣucikäntane | toy saṃtkenta raskäṣlona śār sintāp salyiye yamaṣṣälya|yamaṣlya cūrṇ|curm lykaśke : klawwanalle|kla|wwanalle b5 traiwoṣṣe (warsa niryuhaṃ yamaṣṣälle|yama)ṣle kwarm|kwaräm wärñai • ersaṅkñene tekanmane kartse 19 || |cūrṇaṃ |samaṃ |rūcakahiṅkuma- b6 |(hau)ṣadhānaṃ |(śuṇṭhyambunā |kapha) |s(a)m(ī)r(a)ṇasaṃbhavāsu |hṛtpārśvapṛṣṭajaṭharārtīviṣūcikāsū |peyaṃ |tathā |yavarasena

a1 Sanskrit. Stibnite, rice root, mixed with honey [is] to be drunk with rice water [if] a five-fold a2 female disease [= menorrhagia] has emerged, and also [in case of] (dyspnea) Clerodendrum together with ginger. These remedies have to be increased gradually [and] a powder has to be prepared. It has to be eaten a3 [and it is] good in case of skin diseases. 17. Sanskrit. a4 Sanskrit. A decoction consisting of ricinus, of the heart of the fruit of Aegle marmelos, of two Solanum a5 indicum, of citron, of (Coleus) aromaticus [and] roots of Tribulus terrestris, [with addition] of barley alcali, of Asa foetida, of salt, of ricinus oil. a6 It makes disappear the five-fold pain in the hip, (in the shoulder), in the underbelly organ [= penis], in the heart. This powder has to be drunk together with ginger water. In diseases b1 of wind [and] of phlegma [it is] good. [If] Rubia cordifolia is (mixed with it), (then) [it is] to be drunk with barley water. 18. Sanskrit b2 Sanskrit Asa foetida, Acorus calamus, salt, ginger, b3 Terminalia chebula, cumin, [the root] of Saussurea lappa, [the plant] Saussurea lappa. This [once made turned into] powder has to be increased bit by bit for each part; [it is] recommended in the [following] cases: [in the case] of abdomen tumor, of bowel disease, b4 constipation, choleras. These remedies have to be made bitter; rock salt [and] salt have to be added over it. A fine powder b5 has to be kneaded (with water) of three milk products [and] a clyster has to be (made). [It is] good in case of diseases beginning with [abdomen] tumor in a critical state. 19. Sanskrit b6 Sanskrit
